context: I have the rectangular version of this bacon/meat microwave grill and let me tell you - this is one of the handiest items to have onhand, especially for cooking bacon. I don't know about you, I really enjoy bacon, but it's a pain to cook and it stinks the house up for hours. However, I always jealously noticed how my mother-in-law's bacon always seem to come out perfectly brown, crunchy, and flat. Above all, her kitchen wasn't overly saturated with the bacon smell. When I found out she used one of these Nordic Ware bacon microwave dishes, I was flabberghasted. I went right out and purchase one. Now I make great bacon without the hassle, extra pans, and the extra permeating odor. The odor is now mostly contained in the microwave. The trick to having one of these is figuring out the time/power level formula for making bacon the way you want it. For me, it's 7 minutes on 80% power with a paper towel on top to keep it from splattering. I almost always get bacon the way I want it this way. It gets a little trickier when adding more than two slices, but it's nothing mind-boggling. An extra bonus is that the bacon grease collect on the bottom of the pan (keeps it from interfering with the bacon cooking). Makes it easy to collect bacon grease for different recipes, like collard greens. I usually collect the grease in a jar so I can have it readily on hand for whenever a recipe calls for pork fat or bacon grease. You can also use this item to defrost meats without making a mess of your microwave. You can either use the grill side, or flip it around and use the flat bottom side to do so. The lip keeps the fluids from making a mess. It's dishwasher safe, so all you have to do is drain off the excess grease/liquids and pop it in. The more stubborn stains usually slough off with a scrubbie-sided sponge. This is a great product. I'm very happy to have it.
sentence: I have the rectangular version of this bacon/meat microwave grill and let me tell you - this is one of the handiest items to have onhand, especially for cooking bacon.
title: Nordic Ware Microwave Compact Bacon Rack
target: HAVE(e, THEME=Nordic Ware Microwave Compact Bacon Rack, LOCATION=on hand)

context: After a few joyous months with a loaned Krups FDD912 a relative offered me a Krups 654.  The contrast is unbelievable.  The same buckwheat waffle recipe that popped easily out of the 912 sticks to the 654 like glue, and yes, I let the irons heat up fully and applied cooking oil.  The "non" stick surface is totally different from that used on the FDD912; same cook, same recipe, opposite outcome.  The irons stick so tightly together and the handles are so hot that a wood wedge is necessary to get them apart.  Then, it's ten minutes with a toothpick.  Again.  Oh, and the power cord is only two lousy feet long.  If your kitchen is anything less than Sunset perfect good luck finding a good place to operate it.  And, as others have said, a nightmare to clean.  I could get the irons off the 912, but on the 654 they're bolted in forever near as I can tell.  Some other reviewers apparently avoided sticking; I wonder if my recipe is particularly prone, or maybe the 654 is less forgiving of some unknown bad practice on my part.  Let's put it this way: if your waffle making or your waffle recipes have a history of sticking, even if only once in a while, even if only slightly, you will quickly grow to despise this iron.  I have contemplated giving it away, but am starting to think I shouldn't wish this thing on anyone and should instead hurl it into the nearest landfill.
sentence: I have contemplated giving it away, but am starting to think I shouldn't wish this thing on anyone and should instead hurl it into the nearest landfill..
title: KRUPS F654 Belgian Waffle Maker with Nonstick Plates LED Indicators and Stainless Steel Housing, 4-Slices, Silver

context: Feb 2012:  My review below was before they swapped the original motor for junk while pretending the unit's unchanged. It only looks the same but on opening my newest for 1st periodic cleaning bits flew out that proved to be cheap plastic tie-downs that couldn't stand the heat and the motor windings seemed similarly downgraded.  Check the web for fire hazzard recalls.  Jan 2010: To my original review which follows, I'm just adding this note that Lasko says this model only draws[when new] 83 watts @ High, 69 @ Medium & 56 @ Low Speed. The 170 watts reported elsewhere is in error. I also note neglecting to mention my need to avoid blocking daylight as much as possable, thus clear plastic for the 'shroud' mentioned below.  With no range hood in my city apartment, I've run these [at Mid Speed] virtually 24/7 in my kitchen window for decades, sucking fresh air thru the rest of the apartment while expelling  stove heat & air-borne greece, etc.  I'm comfortable with this because it's relativly easy to take the motor apart for a simple cleaning about once every 9 months [or so].  I've also added 2 4" circular layers of the old, cheap, black, 'washable' air-conditioner filter material between the back of the motor and the interior protective grill to lessen the amoung of gunk sucked into the motor.  What with the cooking, this filter and, for esthetics, the inside grill are also removed & cleaned in the bath tub 3 or 4 times a year. The grills are a pain as soaps are only partly effective & brushes don't quite serve for the tiny grill opening.  With all this beating, the fans have all lasted an astonishing 5yrs++ !  BTW:  To deaden vibration noise, etc. I hang the fan from 2 springs at the top of the window.  I noted that with the fan running I could feel air being sucked in from outside around the sides of the fan so I've made a clear plastic shroud to block these areas for greater efficiency.  I've also taped bits of this plastic on the 4 corners of the inside grill wher some more air circled in & out.
sentence: It only looks the same but on opening my newest for 1st periodic cleaning bits flew out that proved to be cheap plastic tie-downs that couldn't stand the heat and the motor windings seemed similarly downgraded.
title: Lasko 3733 20" Fan Box, Grey White
target: my newest Lasko 3733 20" Fan Box, Grey White

context: I purchased this vacuum based on the recommendation by a friend who owns a cleaning business. She told me that unless I want to shell out the big bucks for a Miele or a Dyson, I will inevitably have to replace vacuum cleaners every few years. My friend uses this Eureka canister vacuum and replaces it every year due to her higher usage, but she swears by this vacuum. I have only used it twice now, but I am pleased so far for the price.  The vacuum does feel cheap. But of course it does. The Mighty Mite is a cheap vacuum, and this is precisely why I bought it since I am going to have to replace it in a few years anyways. The vacuum is easy enough to pull around on my hardwoods and to take off and reattach the floor piece so I can vacuum baseboards, ceiling fans, etc with just the hose. The vacuum doesn't work so well even on my lowest of low-pile rugs though. I find that since I'm too lazy to put in the necessary muscle, I am only moving the floor piece backwards since it's difficult to roll forwards on the rug. Overall, the suction is good for what it is. We will see how the vacuum performs six months and longer from now though, since my opinion may have changed completely. context: This item is advertised as HOOVER BRAND Type Z Allergen Filtration Bags.  I know this because I can see the name and photo match what I have purchased in the past.  What I received, from B&M Housewares, was an off-brand called DVC.  My biggest problem with these DVC bags, although they are Type Z fit, is that they do NOT have Allergen Filtration.  This is either FALSE ADVERTISING or BAIT AND SWITCH, as the price was a little too good from what I have seen for sale elsewhere.  It is hard to tell when ordering what you will actually get, but it should match the description and photo.  This is not the first time that I have received an item via Amazon that is not exactly what is advertised.  I am getting a little tired of returning items that are either wrong, used (when should be new), or defective. ======= UPDATE Shortly after posting this review, I found a note in the packaging with the DVC vacuum bags.  It was a note from B&M Housewares asking that if there was a problem with the order to contact them and not to post a negative review.  Unfortunately, I did not see that note until after I posted the above review.  I apologize to B&M Housewares for not seeing that before my posting.  However, I am not sure that I have ever seen such a note in any other order that I have ordered through Amazon.com, and I have ordered a lot of stuff through Amazon.com.  I now wonder if this has been a problem in the past, not getting the order correct?  A little odd.  Now, I must say that after submitting for a return/exchange, I was notified by Amazon that the seller was refunding my cost, but not requesting the item to be returned.  I did find that to be the case.  My cost was refunded.  That was very nice of them to do that.  However, I would have preferred to exchange the item for what I originally ordered.  That was not an option offered to me.  I really wanted allergen filtration.  I hope these bags hold up. ======= UPDATE # 2 I have not been able to completely get this incident off my mind.  So I checked the seller's ratings.  Apparently they are doing a lot of business through Amazon.  After reading just 1 week of ratings by customers, which was quite a bit, I did see a lot of comments that the seller is delivering products that are not what is advertised or in the photo.  So it was not just 1 mistake that I encountered.  It is happening regularly with this seller.  However, there were a lot of good ratings too.  BUYER BEWARE.
sentence: My biggest problem with these DVC bags, although they are Type Z fit, is that they do NOT have Allergen Filtration.
title: Hoover Type Z Allergen (3-Pack), 4010100Z 3PK Z Allerg Bag
target: they do NOT have Allergen Filtration

context: I purchased this coffee mug based on the reviews here at Amazon, and so far have been pleased.  I grew disillusioned with my Oxo Liqui-Seal mug, and saw recommendations for this cup on those reviews.  This Thermos Nissan keeps my drinks much hotter than the plastic-lined Oxo cup ever did, and does not retain flavors in the liner, so I can use it for hot tea and other drinks after drinking coffee from it.  The lid is a much simpler design, basically a circular insert that screws down to shut, and screws 1/2 turn to open.  The best part about the lid is that there are no crevices or little openings to harbor residue from coffee with milk or cream.  The Oxo cup quickly developed on off-flavor, since there was no way to thoroughly clean it, but this Nissan cup has a very straightforward design, and is totally cleanable!  That was my #1 criteria for a cup.  It is also totally spill-proof, another criteria for this busy mom and teacher.  It has been knocked over several times on my desk at school, without spilling a drop.  It is not as easy to open one-handed (ie while driving) as some other cups, but that is not my primary use for it, so that hasn't been a big deal.  The rubber grips on the cup and the rubberized handle are both easy to hold onto, even with gloves on.  It fits easily in my car cup-holder, and is not overly top-heavy or wobbly on a desk.  It is easy to clean; they recommend washing by hand, but I confess that I've put in the dishwasher a couple of times on particularly busy days, with no ill effects.  The one and only thing I don't like is that you cannot tell by looking at the lid whether it is open or closed.  The only way to know is to either try screwing it open or shut, or to attempt to take a drink.  I quickly developed the habit of screwing it shut immediately after every drink, however, so I know it is always closed.  Overall, this is the best insulated travel cup I've ever owned (and I have a cupboard full!).  It was pricey, but for my purposes, it was worth it to have a mug that I could throw in my bag, and know it would not leak.
sentence: The best part about the lid is that there are no crevices or little openings to harbor residue from coffee with milk or cream.
title: Thermos 14-Ounce Insulated Travel Mug, Black
target: there are no crevices or little openings to harbor residue from coffee with milk or cream
CS: properties OF=lid OF=Thermos 14-Ounce Insulated Travel Mug, Black

context: Having had this item recommended by America's Test Kitchen, I was truly shocked at the product I received. It is the cheapest construction possible and broke on first use scooping cookie dough. This product is made from stamped steel which can be described at best as "poorly and loosely assembled". It is possibly the crappiest thing I have ever purchased, the articulating portion popping out of place after about 10 scoops of cookie dough. I cannot imagine how it could possibly be used for scooping ice cream. First off the handle is of terrible ergonomic design. If you attempted to scoop anything like ice cream your hand would be very sad very quickly. Secondly, the mechanism that is supposed to free the contents of the scoop is simply a piece of the handle metal bent inwards with teeth cut out and "roll" over a gear that has much too wide of spacing.  As it turns out? COUNTERFEIT. See my attached photos of their janky knockoff product.  Below I have a link to a review on YouTube which shows the quality of the actual Norpro product. Do not be fooled. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZpcUdRk3O0c  I could go on but I'm already annoyed that this thing has stolen my time and energy. I have already reported the seller to Amazon Customer Service, but their reporting mechanism doesn't allow for photos, so I thought I'd include them here.
sentence: It is possibly the crappiest thing I have ever purchased, the articulating portion popping out of place after about 10 scoops of cookie dough.
title: Norpro Stainless Steel Scoop, 56MM (4 Tablespoons)
target: PURCHASE(e, AGENT=I, THEME=Norpro Stainless Steel Scoop, 56MM (4 Tablespoons))

context: I love this fan. It's not terribly large, 14' tall I think. The face is about as big as a salad plate. The base is very sturdy, not something the cat can knock off the desk. It has a great force of air which feels very much cooler than the air from lesser fans and while there is a distinct hum it's quieter than a box fan. I run it constantly because of perimenopause hot flashes. Now that spring has sprung so hotly in Seattle I need more! Drawbacks for me: The force of the air is so high and cool that if it's too close then my eardrums get cold and I feel air pressure on them. That may not be an issue for most people because I have damaged eardrums (which might be why it doesn't seem loud to me) but if you've ever been uncomfortable sitting directly under an air conditioner, for instance, that's what I mean. 6ft away and oscillating seems fine to me but closer, or pointed right at me, gets uncomfortable after awhile. On the other hand, you still get a nice cool breeze from much further away ( 12-14 ft) than any other fan I've ever had. At it's furthest range, in my house, it feels like a soft breeze (not too hot or cold) that comes by every 10 seconds. I haven't tried wall mounting it, at the moment it just goes room to room with me. I think I'll try that.
sentence: At it's furthest range, in my house, it feels like a soft breeze (not too hot or cold) that comes by every 10 seconds.
title: Holmes HOAF90-NTUC Blizzard 9" Three-Speed Oscillating Table/Wall Fan, Charcoal

context: I bought this fan to replace the almost identical model that I had used daily for years. Some people have commented on the noise factor of this fan. I may have given up on it thinking it had just worn out before throwing it away and not checking that fuse! That just means I had it for so long I simply forgot about the fuse. The first one worked so well for my purpose I knew I would check to see if they were still available. I did look at other brands and models but this Holmes fan still won out.  There are a few mild changes since the last model but none reflect any critical issues to point out. I will say this fan works just as well as my last one but I am taking away one star just for something in the design that has always bothered me. This is not the easiest fan to clean. There are four screws that attach the front guard to the fan base and makes the blades accessible for cleaning. It's not the easiest fan guard to remove and put back on but it is functional. The problem I have is deep cleaning the back side of the fan housing. There is no real quick and easy way to separate the back of the fan to clean dust and debris from the inside. It's a personal pet peeve and the only issue I have with the fan. context: I grew up cranking ice cream using White Mountain Ice Cream makers. I was delighted when my mother-in-law bought me one for Christmas 2014. Used it one time and the crank wanted to bind up then, but I thought, "hey, it's new, just needs to be broken in a little." Second time out July 4th weekend, the crank bound repeatedly. Then it began 'jumping a gear' causing the canister to not turn. After getting thoroughly frustrated and doing everything exactly as the directions said, I was so embarrassed in front of my company.  My father went and got his 35+ year old White Mountain Crank handle out that was a bit rusty and has not been used in 5 years. We attached it and it worked like a dream. I called customer service the next day and was treated like I was an idiot and got no where with the customer service rep. Though purely speculative I wonder if they are well trained to just frustrate you to the point you will give up and go away. My wife called them too--she was treated the same.  I have over 20 years of mechanic and extensive machine shop experience in building things that are way beyond the confines of a ice cream maker gear box. So I took the thing apart as well as my father's 35 year old White Mountain drive mechanism apart to compare and see just what is going on inside the one I have that malfunctions so bad.  The drive mechanism in the newer one has to be the absolute sloppiest made piece of junk I have ever seen. In comparison to the old one...there is not a comparison. The new castings are awful and not even close to being the same. That said, The White Mountain is NOW only a name. White Mountain, like many once-upon-a-time-American companied does put out the quality of product I grew up hearing about and using.  DO NOT BUY this Ice Cream Maker unless you want a $200.50 decoration for your rustic homstead.  . Go buy some Breyers and call it a day. Now off to the machine shop out back to do what White Mountain cannot do--fix their problem.
sentence: The drive mechanism in the newer one has to be the absolute sloppiest made piece of junk I have ever seen.
title: White Mountain F64306-X 6-Quart Hand-Crank Ice Cream Freezer

context: Eminem's official third solo album (technically, it's his 5th) is the best one yet. He is a lyrical genius. His newest single isn't that good anymore, since radio has played it out. Here is a track-by-track review of the CD. 1. Curtains Up- 2 stars This isn't really a track, just a skit to start it out. He just clears his throat. 2. White America- 4 stars This is a great song, telling about how people just like and listen to his music because he is white. Definitely to be concidered as a single. Good beat. 3. Business- 5 stars This is one of my favorite songs on the album. It has a great beat, and for some reason, I hear myself singing the chorus to myself. Very catchy! Makes fun of a lot of stuff. 4. Cleaning Out My Closet- 4 1/2 stars This is a great song, has a good beat. About him talking about his mom is crazy, and he is moving out and cleaning out his closet. 5. Square Dance- 4 stars I like this song, has a good beat, and is funny sort of. Makes fun of people with a southern accent. Makes fun of Cannibus on it. .... 6. The Kiss- 3 stars A skit re-making the "alleged" incident when Kim was accused of kissing John Guerra, and Eminem pistol whipped him. 7. Soldier- 3 1/2 stars Okay song, with okay beat. I don't really like this song too much 8. Say Goodbye To Hollywood- 4 stars Talks about Kim, and stuff like that. Good beat, well written. 9. Drips- 4 1/2 stars Great beat, well written. Talks about Kim cheating on him and getting diseases, and giving it to him. 10. Without Me- 3 1/2 stars The song everyone knows. I don't really listen to it, since you just turn on the radio, and it's on. Okay song, mediocre beat. Good when it is new though. 11. Paul- 1 star ... there really is no point to it. 12. Sing For The Moment- 5 stars Excellent beat, very well written. It is meant to be a song to hear when you're in a happy mood. 13. Superman- 4 1/2 stars Great song. I like the beat, and it has great lyrics. You should definitely listen to this track. 14. Hailie's Song- 4 stars This is a nice song, with a good beat, and well written. Dedicated to Hailie, Eminem's daughter. You should like this song too. Good rap after the song. 15. Steve Berman- 2 1/2 stars This is the same stuff as the past two albums, except that he actually likes the album instead of hating it. You hear "Ain't Nuttin But Music" from D-12's album "Devil's Night". 16. When The Music Stops- 4 1/2 stars This song features D-12. Has a great beat, should be listened to. 17. Till I Collapse- 3 1/2 stars This song is a little weaker than previous tracks. Features Nate Dogg. Has a good beat, but Nate Dogg is only in the chorus. He should have been in a little more. 19. My Dad's Gone Crazy- 4 stars This song has a good beat, well written. Features Hailie Mathers! You hear her in some parts during the song wheh she said "I think my dad's gone craazay!" About when Eminem is acting weird and Hailie thinks Eminem has gone crazy. 20. Curtains Close- 5 stars This is so much better than Curtains Open. A hilarious track featuring the one and only Ken Kaniff! Here is what he says, mocking "Without Me". Guess who's back/Back again/Ken is back/Tell some men/Rub my back/Rub my back... You need to buy this CD! I would have given it 4 1/2 stars, but you can only give whole numbers. You should definetely buy this CD if you like Rap music. I really like this CD.

context: OK; so my lifelong inventory of pepper containers has been somewhat limited, Ill admit.  From the beginning where I used the rectangular tin container at the table, I eventually upgraded to a pepper shaker.  You know the type at most diners which you fill with ground black pepper flakes?  Then a colleague at work gently let me know, I was doing it wrong.  I should use a pepper mill since there is a culinary advantage to having the freshly ground peppercorns used.  I quickly saw the light and purchased a mill some 25 years ago.  That was a William Bounds Key Mill in walnut.  At the time the price seemed rather steep since I was replacing a glass container with a screw top.  But that mill performed at every meal for all those years without a problem, and still performs today.  So why the purchase of this unit?  After 25 years of use, the walnut mill was showing the signs of being older and the finish was blemished from rings and long fingernails from the last quarter century of grinding.  The salt and sugar shaker were glass and translucent which displayed the color and quantity of the contents, which removed any guesswork regarding refills.  So I figured a see through pepper mill would make a good candidate for replacement (I still have the walnut unit, like anyone would throw these away).  Enter the WB-1, Key Mill in acrylic.  The extended handle facilitates easier grinding with the extra leverage from the arm, and therefore delivers a greater quantity of ground pepper with less effort.  The filling slots are narrow but if you place the grinder in a small bowl or baggie before filling, you will recover any stray peppercorns which may try and escape (playing Rawhide as background music makes this task somewhat ironic and less intense).  Keep in mind that many blended peppers include allspice, which is not technically a peppercorn and much larger in diameter.  You also have three setting for the texture of grind: coarse, medium, and fine, which is easily adjusted by rotating the bezel on top of the mill.  The clear body makes it easy to identify quantity while acting as a showcase for your finest Tellicherry, Sarawak or Lampong peppercorns.  So after more than ten months of daily use, I can report the performance of this mill as being similar to the one which served so well for the previous 25 years.
sentence: The clear body makes it easy to identify quantity while acting as a showcase for your finest Tellicherry, Sarawak or Lampong peppercorns.
title: William Bounds 00900 Key Mill "WB-1" - Salt Grinder -  Chrome and Acrylic
target: your finest Tellicherry, Sarawak or Lampong peppercorns

context: The description is adequate.  You get a well-enough-made, non-stick, taco rack that makes four tacos at a time. It is pictured upright. The price is not bad for a specialty item but would be far cheaper if everybody wanted one. I expect it to last many years but it's not heirloom quality.  I've just ordered my second rack and may order a third to make enough for parties. I had to play with my method as I wanted no oil. The biggest trick is getting your tortillas flimsy enough to rest on the rack without cracking. This works best for me: * I'm using regular sized corn tortillas (35 calories no fat each). * Individually steam the tortillas for just under a minute (I use a bamboo steamer). Microwaving did not work for me. * Use tongs to transfer and place on the rack. * Bake at 350 for about twenty-five minutes (rotate rack half-way through for even cooking). I live at sea level in very low humidity. Other instructions suggest shorter cook times at higher temps -- my burn frequency increases when I cook faster. * Tacos get shaped by the rack but don't stick to the rack. * I bake tortilla chips while I'm at it. Cut the tortillas into wedges, sprinkle with whatever (lemon pepper is my current favorite) and spray with white vinegar to make the pepper stick. I suppose you could spice up your tacos the same way.  The result is a very crunchy, healthy, no fat taco. They are also slow to absorb moisture.
sentence: The biggest trick is getting your tortillas flimsy enough to rest on the rack without cracking.
title: Chicago Metallic Professional 6-Shell Baked Taco Rack, 15-Inch-by-7-Inch
target: getting your tortillas flimsy enough to rest on the rack without cracking

context: I just got this stuff in the mail for my birthday. I know, an odd Bday gift, but I love this kind of fare. First thing is, shake it up really well or even stir it before you pour it because all of the oil builds up at the top and you won't get the full effect if you don't thoroughly mix it. Let me say that I am a heat eating heavyweight, so to say. I knew this stuff was going to be HOT. I reminded myself to be wise about the amount I used. I normally carry cayenne pepper in my purse as a personal condiment and I use a stockpile of habanaroes every week. Everything I eat is not just spicy, but tongue numbing hot. I will say. I bought two cups of chili and added ONE TEASPOON of Dave's 2009. I thought that would be a good place to start. Wow. Not so bad at first. Spicy, but pleasant. Then it hits the back of your throat and you have to cough. Then your nose is running. Then you are sweating. Then your ears and hair start to burn. It sounds nightmarish, I know. But, I love it and this was totally worth it. This stuff goes a long, long way. In no way should you use this stuff as a dip or drizzle it on top of anything, like your pizza. I believe it is best enjoyed when you combine it in small amounts (or large if you're F-ing crazy) to dishes like soup, pasta sauce, chili, bbq sauce, mashed potatoes, or any blended side dish. I think that is the best way to enjoy this. Anyways, I love it. I don't know if I wanna dropkick Dave in the nuts or give him a bear hug!
sentence: I believe it is best enjoyed when you combine it in small amounts (or large if you're F-ing crazy) to dishes like soup, pasta sauce, chili, bbq sauce, mashed potatoes, or any blended side dish.
title: Dave's Ghost Pepper Jolokia Private Reserve Hot Sauce
target: enjoy(e, STIMULUS=Dave's Ghost Pepper Jolokia Private Reserve Hot Sauce, MANNER=combine it in small amounts (or large if you're F-ing crazy) to dishes like soup, pasta sauce, chili, bbq sauce, mashed potatoes, or any blended side dish)

context: Perfect size for the stove top popcorn maker with the crank.  Spot on salt, to oil to corn measurement and uses coconut oil just like the movie theaters do for the highest quality and best tasting popcorn.  There was a scare back several years ago, a movie theater popcorn was compared to the fat content in six big mac sandwiches.  Many went to using canola oil and others, but the coconut oil was no where near as bad as the fat found in a hamburger and cheese.  Today many theaters have reverted back, and coconut oil is found to help not hurt bad cholesterol counts.  It's still a good Idea to do in moderation, but you can't beat the good taste.  Recommended for popcorn lovers who get tired of air poppers or micro bags.  This is the real stuff guys, I'm now on my third order of this with the sample that came with the Whirley Pop machine.  Perfect for use on a gas stove and the high quality corn and just the right mix of buttery coconut oil and salt.  You can limit the salt a bit if you want, but it's really not overkill unless you're on a low salt diet.  These are a bit expensive, it breaks down to about 3 bucks a batch.  Made in the Whirley Pop on the stovetop, it shakes out to about 2 of the large bags of something like Pop Secret Microwave corn.  The difference in the taste is very noticeable however, so if you really want an authentic movie night in front of your 60" TV, this does the trick.  You won't find those Pop Secret bags with coconut oil, and they just don't taste the same.  FYI, I've tried two other kinds with these combo packs available in the grocery or specialty stores, and this is by far the best.
sentence: Spot on salt, to oil to corn measurement and uses coconut oil just like the movie theaters do for the highest quality and best tasting popcorn.
title: Wabash Valley Farms Popcorn All-Inclusive Popping Kits - Real Theater Popcorn - 5 Pack - 27.5oz

context: I have recently been trying to cut out all of my artificial sweetener intake.  It's amazing how many products have these chemicals in our food and drinks!  Even my Metamucil had aspartame!  I've been looking for a low to no calorie sweetener for my coffee.  I have been hooked on Splenda, LOVE the taste.  Recently I've discovered that Splenda and all artificial sweeteners are really just carcinogens I'm ingesting daily. I did know about this to some extent, but once I started researching it and understood just how many chemicals and heavy metals are used to make these artificial sugars, I went on the hunt for a safe and natural sweetener.  Stevia is what I found to be the safest and most natural sweetener, even is used for medicinal purposes in some countries.  So I tried Stevita Supreme.  I first tried it just plain....and don't recommend that!  It wasn't a pleasant taste and I almost threw it out right then.  So glad I didn't! I decided to give it a chance and tried it in my coffee and was very surprised how much I liked it!  I think it tastes close to Splenda.  It has no aftertaste and sweetens my coffee just how I like it.  These packets are not pure Stevia, so I use them to the same ratio of regular sugar.  The only downside I can see is that Stevia Supreme is not pure Stevia, it contains Xylitol, actually more Xylitol than Stevia.  I am going to try Pure Stevia Powder by KAL brand next to see which I like better.  I've heard good reviews about the KAL Pure Stevia and it is the most natural form of Stevia.  I will try to update with which kind I like best.
sentence: I will try to update with which kind I like best..

context: For some reason, known only to the powers that make such decisions, this bland, Twinings Prince of Wales Tea is not longer readily found on supermarket shelves.  You can still find it in variety packs, but It has been sometime since I have been able to find a whole box of the stuff.  That is a pity, but as I am what you might call a "tea hoarder," I had two boxes in my stash and was rationing it slow out.  You can imagine my delight when I found you could purchase this product through Amazon!  Prince of Wales tea has a nice robust taste but no bitterness.  It is one of the few teas I can (if I so desire) drink without adding some sort of sweetener.  It never use mild or cream as my wife does, so for me that is a nice factor.  I simply like the flavor of this tea.  Twinings has been around (It is based in England) for a bit over 200 years now and there is a reason for this...they provide a fine quality product.  We are constantly trying new teas as we locate them, but it seems that over the years we keep coming back to this brand.  Now as has been noted by another reviewer here, this stuff is NOT packaged in England; it is packaged and distributed here in America.  This does not magically change the flavor of the tea though.  Tea is tea is tea.  Tea is NOT grown in England, so to say that tea that is packaged in England is better than that packaged in America is simply codwollop!  Yes, you might get "stale" tea here, but I doubt it. If you keep your tea under proper storage conditions, i.e. out of the light, no moisture and away from heat, it will last quite some time...I can assure you that the producers do this simply because they want to sell you the best tasting product possible. We in this country may not be as adept to brewing tea as our English brothers, but I doubt it.  No, the difference in the taste is more than likely all in the drinkers head.  The biggest problem I have and the biggest problem I have noted in our country when it comes to drinking tea made using tea bags is that we seem to be a very, very impatient people.  We simply do not, generally speaking of course, do not let it steep long enough.  A tea such as the one being reviewed here needs to steep no less that three minutes; preferably at least four.  I find myself getting in a bit of a hurry at times and end up drinking very weak and rather tasteless tea simply because I did not wait long enough.  Note:  Cost wise, this is on the rather high end for tea bag tea...in my opinion it is quite worth it though.  Anyway, enough of my babbling...this is a good tea.  Is it the only tea I drink or ever will drink?  Of course not.  3/4s of the fun of being a tea drinker is continuing throughout life trying different blends and brands.  I will say though that I most certainly have not grown tired of this stuff...yet.  Don Blankenship The Ozarks
sentence: The biggest problem I have and the biggest problem I have noted in our country when it comes to drinking tea made using tea bags is that we seem to be a very, very impatient people.
title: Twinings of London Pure Camomile Herbal Tea Bags, 20 Count
target: note(e, AGENT=I, TOPIC=we are a very, very impatient people)
CS: note(e, AGENT=I, TOPIC=problems, SYNCHRONOUS=drinking tea made using tea bags)

context: I've been bouncing around from one brand of green tea to another for some time now, everything I could find in the budget priced range, from supermarket brands to specialty offerings from Costco and Trader Joes. Yes there are some wonderful and exotic greens out there, but I'm talking everyday stuff that won't make me feel *too* guilty while my husband enjoys his own favorite: Lipton's Eu De Ubiquitous Yellow Box.  (Because even the cheapest green costs considerably more, ounce for ounce, than "default" orange Pekoe.)  Anyway, I think I've finally found the stuff.  Twinings Green has a bright quality that is maybe a *bit* strong on the tannins, but doesn't have that vegetal taste that green teas can.  I'm no expert -- for all I know, this translates to "something missing" to a connoisseur, but my less educated palate perceives some greens as "mown alfalfa" -- not my favorite flavor.  And the tea is smooth.  Newbies should know that you want to steep green tea in water that is only just getting hot; boiling water will give you a nasty, bitter taste that only gets worse as it cools.  I'm ready to try the Twinings as an iced tea -- even at room temperature, I'm detecting nothing but green-y goodness.
sentence: (Because even the cheapest green costs considerably more, ounce for ounce, than "default" orange Pekoe.)  Anyway, I think I've finally found the stuff.
title: Twinings of London English Afternoon Black Tea Bags, 20 Count (Pack of 6)

context: I love the Just Cheese bars. It's basically just crisped cheese, some of which have powdered flavoring mixed in. This one is jalepeno, which is my favorite. In fact it's the only flavor my wife & I can agree on (I also really like the Pizza flavor, but my wife hates them). Just goes to show you how different individual tastes vary.  But I do have mixed feelings about Just the Cheese - it's a genius idea. A convenient, single-serving bar of crispy cheese, to throw in your bag or glove box for a low carb snack. But 3 problems:  (1) Too much sodium. I have to guzzle a glass of water after eating a bar. And these are only 1/2 ounce!  (2) Taste isn't always consistent. Sometimes you get a burned piece.  (2) The price (over $1 per bar) is really too high for 1/2 ounce of cheese.  The Atkins & South Beach bars are much cheaper - usually 2.7-3.5 ounces (nearly 5-7 times more) for about the same price. I do not think this product should cost SIX TIMES what an Atkins bar costs.  These bars get a 3.5 stars for me. If the company would fix these problems, I'd give it a 5.  PS - If you like the idea of zero carb cheese snacks, you can easily make these yourself at home in just a few minutes:  Put a little oil (or Pam) on aluminum foil, sprinkle on some shredded hard cheese from the bag (Parmesan is the easiest and most widely available), and bake it in an oven for 5-10 minutes until it turns golden brown. A great serving size is 20-30 half-dollar sized parmesan bites/crisps, on a normal sized baking pan. A toaster oven or convection oven is best - it makes fewer servings, but will crisp faster (3-4 minutes on 400-450). And the great thing is, if you're a low carber who misses chips & dip, your homemade cheese crisps are easily dip-able in salsa, sour cream, etc.

context: Celiac Disease is only a small percentage of symptoms from gluten allergies.  I knew I always had issues with eating bread, pizza, and pasta.  After many negative tests I finally got the positive result for Celiac disease....I wondered how three previous tests were negative.  Then, December 2012, my son went into anaphylaxis shock over gluten.  My son ate gluten for the first ten years of his life with no severe reactions.  Actually, no reactions.  The doctors had no real advice, no logical explanation for his new deadly reaction to gluten.  We have eli-pens everywhere now.  Answers:  If you think gluten makes you feel sluggish, tired, or your children seem pink under the eyes, over tired, sluggish and you can't put your finger on it.  You should take the 37 minutes and watch this movie on youtube named: "gluten sensitivity vs. celiac disease vs. gluten intolerance" by Glutenology.  The link: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cv5RwxYW8yA  This video changed my life and my understanding that was based on 1950's mentality.  Just watch it and if you think it doesn't apply to you or someone you love you just might be in denial.  Now back to Pamela's Baking mix.  It is hands down delicious.  It cooks well and my favorite is cooking it with banana slices and cinnamon in olive oil.  I've made an entire batch and ate them until I was sick.  However, before I knew it, my stomach had digested them, I felt great the next couple of days, and all body systems were normal.  Had I splurged on regular wheat pancakes I would have tossed and turned all night, bent over in pain, and no systems would have been working normally.  Since you are reading my review up to this point I think you just might be interested in my opinion.  So, this is it....feed this to your family instead of the regular gluten stuff.  You NEVER KNOW when your child could just suddenly have a deadly gluten allergy.  I have dreadful thoughts that we could have been camping miles from any help, with no Benadryl, no Epi-Pen, and my son's throat would have swollen shut.  Seriously, something is going on with our farming, our food, and children are suffering.  Maybe we started having issues as we grew up (obesity out of control, colon cancer huge killer) and we passed that irritation onto our children.  With each generation the reactions are more severe.  Gluten is the starch in the seed of grasses.  Corn is 55% while wheat is 68-69%.  That means your corn chips actually have gluten.  So many products claiming gluten free are not.  We learned by watching my son go into shock after eating them.  Pamela's is a solid brand with a solid product.  Never once has he had any reaction.  This gluten thing for us is LIFE AND DEATH, and last year at this time, we had NO IDEA, this year we would have this common food ingredient our deadliest enemy.  If you have children always keep an eye on rashes, swelling lips, hives, vomiting, red circles under their eyes, stomach aches, and itching.  Know the symptoms of an allergic reaction. AND ALWAYS carry liquid Benadryl with you.  Liquid matters when a reaction comes on and minutes matter.  Keep a bottle in your purse, you car, your camping kit, your hiking kit, at grandmas, and for sleep overs.  My son is alive because I learned in college how important Benadryl was and had it on hand.  We gave it to him and it helped keep him breathing until the ambulance arrived.  Message me if you are experiencing gluten allergies with your children or yourself.  My girlfriend and I are compiling information and stories for a book, youtube channel, and a blog.  It's something we are just starting and we know we won't be the first but with more information, stronger voices, maybe we can impact one family by helping them be prepared and save their child's life.  I have Pamela's stuff on Subscribe & Save with S'moreables, Anne's Gluten free Mac & Cheese, Enjoy Life Chocolate Chip cookies, and the list goes on. We get a case of 6 or more delivered every month.  It's the best way to do it and it's a BEST price.  Most of these items are 40% more in the health food stores.  This is not cheap stuff.  Indeed, it's worth every penny for my son to eat well, safely, and enjoy it.  I would love to personally thank Pamela's, Anne's, and all the other businesses that provide such quality products.  They have made my life as a mother easier and my son's life safer.
sentence: This gluten thing for us is LIFE AND DEATH, and last year at this time, we had NO IDEA, this year we would have this common food ingredient our deadliest enemy.
title: Pamela's Products Gluten Free Baking & Pancake Mix, 24-Ounce Packages (Pack of 6)

context: We enjoyed Farmer Bros coffee for many years at work. Then the business closed down and we only could drink it at reataurants or donut shops. So, I had to mix it with Sumatra or Costa Rica beans to use up 5# bag!!! I go there yesterday and ask for their freshest bag. I get it. Drive it to work, but NO SCENT ON THE CAR!! Brewed a pot...and STILL NOT LIKE THE OLD BREW! Had a nutty flavor. Wife was bloody upset! Had to go to McDonald's for her coffee. Ran to buy more Sumatra and Costa Rican coffee at T.J.s to save the day. STRIKE 2 for Farmer Bros. Went to the Donut shop. I see Supreme Plus on their brewer. I ask her. She says, "no, get their cheapest brand, they have several types". So, I am returning this BAD "Gourmet" IMITATION to the shop, and if they do not carry the old traditional packaged (beige with brown lettering), their CEO must have left or died, and so did their traditional blend. But the Donut shop gets it!  I do not see the old blend even here at Amazon. So, hope you can get used to this NEW blend... cause it AINT THE TRADITIONAL FLAVOR :(

context: I was kind of skeptical in believing that drinking a tea could actually make a difference so I was surprised with the results. Since I was feeling a bit sluggish and bloated I thought I would try it.  Just to start, I'm a 55 year old female, not on any medications.  I am currently on the off week of the detox.  Here's some of the things that happened to me after 4 weeks of drinking the tea once a day. 1.  Before the tea, I was getting headaches every other day, sometimes everyday.  They wouldn't last long, maybe an hour or 2 and I never took anything for them because they weren't that intense.  After 3 weeks of the tea, I wasn't getting headaches anymore.  This is the most significant change I've noticed. 2.  Before the tea, I was getting hot flashes every couple of hours, lasting maybe a minute or 2.  The result was that I had strong body odor in places I didn't know you could get body odor, my wrists and elbows, my belly, even the back of my knees, I would literally have to clean those areas several times a day and wear a light perfume.  While the tea didn't affect the intensity or frequency of the hot flashes, I noticed that I didn't have body odor at all anymore. 3.  Before the tea, I was mildly lactose intolerant.  The lactose pills worked very well for me, but after 3 weeks of the tea, I wasn't lactose intolerant anymore. 4.  Losing weight was not a motivation for my taking this tea as I'm not overweight but after the 3rd week I did find I lost 3 lbs. 5.  Having said that I lost weight, after the 3rd week, I was bloat free which helped my sluggishness. Some things to know: -  It's honestly not tasty - it tastes very herbal.  I added a couple dried prunes and some dried cranberries since those help your liver and kidneys.  It made it more tolerable. -  I drank it in the morning.  I found I couldn't sleep well if I drank at night, not because it has caffeine, but because I would have to go to the bathroom several times at night. -  I didn't have any noticeble skin or hair changes like others have reported, but I am not expecting to see any results until the 3rd or 4th month.  Hair and skin results can take a while to appear. -  Be patient - I didn't have any results until literally after the third week and keep in mind, they may not be results you would expect.  I wasn't expecting my headaches to go away. Hope this review helped you.
sentence: This is the most significant change I've noticed.
title: Yogi Tea - Peach DeTox - Healthy Warming Blend - 6 Pack, 96 Tea Bags Total
target: notice(e, EXPERIENCER=I, STIMULUS=after 3 weeks of the tea, I wasn't getting headaches anymore)
CS: notice(e, EXPERIENCER=I, STIMULUS=(changes, CAUSER=Yogi Tea - Peach DeTox - Healthy Warming Blend - 6 Pack, 96 Tea Bags Total))

context: I love the Just Cheese bars. It's basically just crisped cheese, some of which have powdered flavoring mixed in. This one is white cheddar pizza flavored, which I also liked.  You can easily make these yourself at home in just a few minutes: Put a little oil (or Pam) on aluminum foil, sprinkle on some shredded hard cheese from the bag (Parmesan is the easiest and most widely available), and bake it in an oven for 5-10 minutes until it turns golden brown. A great serving size is 20-30 half-dollar sized parmesan bites/crisps, on a normal sized baking pan. A toaster oven or convection oven is best - it makes fewer servings, but will crisp faster (3-4 minutes on 400-450). And the great thing is, if you're a low carber who misses chips & dip, your homemade cheese crisps are easily dip-able in salsa, sour cream, etc.  If you want to replicate the "Just the Cheese" flavor, take the package of powdered cheese from a box of "white cheese" flavored mac & cheese, and sprinkle it in. Therein lies the problem for me - wayyyy too much sodium. Cheese already has a lot of sodium. But add flavoring, and it can get overwhelming fast. After just one Just the Cheese bar, I have to guzzle a glass of water.  So I have mixed feelings - I think this product is a genius idea. A convenient, single-serving bar of crispy cheese, to throw in your bag or glove box for a low carb snack. But I grade it down for 3 reasons:  (1) Too much sodium. However, some of the other "plain" flavors have a bit less sodium.  (2) Taste isn't always consistent. Sometimes you get a burned piece.  (2) The price (over $1 per bar) is really too high for 1/2 ounce of cheese.  The Atkins & South Beach bars are much cheaper - usually 2.7-3.5 ounces (nearly 5-7 times more) for about the same price. I do not think this product should cost SIX TIMES what an Atkins bar costs.  3.5 stars for me. If the company would fix these problems, I'd give it a 5.
sentence: You can easily make these yourself at home in just a few minutes: Put a little oil (or Pam) on aluminum foil, sprinkle on some shredded hard cheese from the bag (Parmesan is the easiest and most widely available), and bake it in an oven for 5-10 minutes until it turns golden brown.
title: Just the Cheese Snack Bars,  Jalapeno Cheese, 15 - 0.5-Ounce Bars

Drinking it is worse: I thought there was something wrong with my senses after my first sip because there was no taste at all. After a few more attempts it got very, very slightly better - in that if you hold the tea in your mouth you might just be able to detect a bit of tartness, and you get a two-second aftertaste of something sour. context: The first few uses I was impressed. Let's just say we found lots of reasons to use these food dyes. I need them for things like icing cakes and cupcakes for birthdays, otherwise I end up at Whole Foods paying a good $35. We used all three colors with pretty good results. We made map-water blue, a pale green, and light-light-light red in buttercream.  The downside, and what I later found out by coming back to read the reviews, was that the dyes have a very short shelf life. Like a few short months. The dyes start separating (our red and yellow was already on the verge when we got it, turns out) and you won't get the same vibrancy.  Now, here's the saddest part. My daughter wanted a carrot cake for her birthday. So I thought, yeah, I can use white chocolate to make the carrot decorations. Got the white chocolate melted, got a decent but very pale green, added a bit more...and seized the chocolate. I went ahead and tried for orange (using the red and yellow of course) and was even more let down by how fast that seized. I managed to eke out a few passable carrots and used the green to write her name and age.  This product is for you if you are so tired of Whole Foods not sharing all their food dyes with you. I mean, why don't they carry dyes?? Why? Anyway, this does the job you'll need it for as long as you need it done quickly. For people like me who have children who can't comprehend why they can't have carrot decorations on their carrot cake, the price tag isn't a hindrance.
sentence: Now, here's the saddest part.

The chain can be adjusted in length up to 21", a feature rarely found in jewelry in this price category.  Mr. Hedgehog's metal work isn't perfect; he has some dings already. Even though he's made out of mystery metal and not perfection on a chain, I recommend this fashion hedgehog pendant to most. context: I'll start by saying I did a tonne of research on alexandrite before purchasing this ring. A prior buyer wrote a fantastic review far more detailed than I, and included great pictures as one of my biggest concerns with purchasing an alexandrite ring online was that I wasn't going to get to see if it did possess colour changing properties. While lab created, this stone really does change colours in daylight and by candlelight, in soft light and under pot lights. It is a beautiful deep eggplant purple in regular light, changes to a raspberry in different light and has blue/green undertones in different light. The setting is unique with the emerald cut alexandrite turned on its side to be a diamond shape, and the double prongs at each corner are stunning but still lend to simplicity which lets the colour and size of this stone shine through. At 2.75 carats it's not overwhelming in size but is small enough to look "genuine" and not just a cocktail ring. The white gold ring itself is fairly dainty, it looks bigger in the Peora pictures but I was pleased with this feature. context: I'm a big fan of the open cardigan concept.  Not only are they stylish and cute, they also keep me warm in our frigid offices at work. The black one I've had for years has been looking worn and pilled for a while now, so I bought this one online at a discount for my honest and unbiased review to replace it.  Here are my thoughts on this Elain & J Long Sleeve Open Cardigan:  IT'S THIN The material is very thin, much thinner than I expected. If held to the light, it is see-through. This can be a pro or con -- it's doesn't keep me as warm, but then again it's also not too heavy when I just need something light covering me.  THE TAILS ARE LONG The woman in the model picture must have a very long torso. The longest part (the front) of the garment comes down just a few inches above my knee.  It covers my rear in the back as well. I ordered a small and am 5 feet tall.  IT'S SHEDDING? I've only had this cardigan for a few days, but I noticed today that I had tiny black pieces of fabric on my pants.  I rubbed the cardigan in my hands and sure enough, I had a small amount of fabric shedding in my hands. Maybe this goes away after a few washes?  Overall, I like it -- it serves the purpose I need for work and it goes well with everything.  I wish it was a little bit better quality, but I plan to keep wearing it either way.
sentence: The longest part (the front) of the garment comes down just a few inches above my knee.

context: This fits me well enough that I am happy, especially at this price-point. I'm lucky that I could try it on in a store to see the actual fit before purchasing. Because this lower-end item fits me fine, I will look into trying this brand's higher-end women's clothing in the future. I rated it 4/5 stars at this point because I don't yet know how the fabric and construction will hold up under heavy use and washing. [SEE update below.]  - Get the size that fits your full bust measurement, even if you are above a UK G-cup. It will be the best size for you; anything smaller will be too small in the bust. I am a UK 34GG/H and the XL does not pull across my bust unless I put my shoulders back completely.* This is cut for movement, but if you are a properly-sized A- through C-cup and always have problems with your shoulders being too large for your clothing, consider sizing up; I would not normally suggest this, but you need to make sure you can move in this if you're cooking.  - Do a search for UNCOMMON THREADS clothing elsewhere to find their sizing charts - do not rely on the standard Amazon sizing by bust measurement or you will probably end up purchasing something that is too large for you. (I suspect that reviewers who said the size they bought was too big probably went by standard Amazon women's top sizing by bust measurement.)  - The listing right now says it has cloth-covered buttons, but you can see from the picture they are the plastic pearl-type, not cloth.  - The sleeve on me is ridiculously long, but that is typical since I have to size up for my bust and the assumption is if you're bigger around, your arms are longer. When I fold up the full cuff, the sleeves are about bracelet-length on me.  - Similarly, the overall length is too long for me, but because of the side slits, it fits fine over my hips. I will probably shorten the length and may/may not move the side-slit origin up.  - The extra ease in the overall garment and in the back doesn't really bother me in this jacket; since I will be moving a lot when using it, the extra space is appropriate.  *Specifically: My bust measures 45" at the fullest, but at my full bustline, the front/back ratio is 26/19. The armscye is too large and cuts too far forward on my body, due to the back being too wide and the front being too narrow for my shape. When I put my shoulders back completely, the front pulls a little and the back is wrinkled. In regular use, it it loose enough that this doesn't pose a problem for me, especially since, when cooking, my arms will mostly be forward. If you are a UK H-cup or higher, you may have more of a problem with this front/back proportion problem, depending on your bustline vertical fullness and other things like vertical torso proportions and boob placement.  FYI: I have problems with commercially-sized clothing fitting my body shape due to a proportionately larger bust and shorter torso and overall body height.  ------------------------------------------------------- Update: It has performed incredibly well, cleans easily in the wash, and looks exactly the same as it did when I got it. I changed my rating to 5 stars.  I wasn't sure about the 65/35 poly/cotton fabric, but, so far, the easy-clean and no-iron-needed aspects are far outweighing the slightly less breathable, slightly hotter-wearing negatives. The only improvement I can see is if they offered it in different curviness sizes like Pepperberry or BiuBiu or similar stores.
sentence: *Specifically: My bust measures 45" at the fullest, but at my full bustline, the front/back ratio is 26/19.

context: My first experience with Boxy was the very affordable, but very unattractive, cube-looking "Boxy Winder" as they called it, which was also marketed under other brand names.  It had an awful fake carbon fiber print front, with a large submarine bubble cover.  But, it was affordable, small, and able to stack with other Boxy Winders, so I wound up getting more, especially since it performed flawlessly at the most important task -- silently keeping my watch wound.  Since then, I see they have the "Fancy Brick" now, which is kind of an upgraded version of the original cube, plus this new series, the Castle Series, which I think is just about the best winder on the market and the fact that it's hundreds less than other winders that don't even look this good is just amazing, and my hat is off to Boxy on this winning design.  I did not buy it here, because it wasn't on Amazon yet, but seeing it here now, I wanted to leave a review for other folks looking for a good winder.  With a small collection of various Swiss automatics, I have bought a number of winders over the years, and always I'd rather spend less where possible, so I have more money for more watches!  But a winder has to do the job.  I've had some good luck with Heiden, Belocia, even Chiyoba, and of course I love my Wolf Winder, but to date this really about the best winder I've purchased, and the price is really stunning for what you get.  This is a hardwood, matte finish, beautiful piece of furniture, with a glass cover that glides down on soft touch hinges.  The interior is finished in black and the clean, modern design is incredibly attractive.  They aren't trying to fancy it up, just keeping it simple and streamlined, and the result that it looks far more expensive than what you paid, and avoids the "budget" look of inexpensive winders that try to save money with plastic lids, fake stitched leather and overly glossed veneer finishes.  So, if you are looking for a winder you can be proud to display, this is the one, and your watches look great shining out from the dark interior (which very effectively highlights your watches as the main attraction).  And, speaking of shining out -- this has LIGHTS!!!  Yup, two LED's inside light up your beautiful time pieces whenever it feels vibration, such as opening the cover.  And yes, you can turn those off, with a simple push of a button.  If there is any tiny drawback to this model, at all, it is probably that the controls are recessed into the front of the unit, and are a bit difficult to reach, for initial set up.  That's a very minor thing though, compared to everything that is so outstanding about this winder and it's not an area you need to access more than once anyway.  Movement is absolutely silent, the watch holding mechanism is simple but effective, with a very firm foam pillow that fits snugly into the cradle, holding your watch very secure.  Another great feature?  Like other Boxy winders, it always returns your watch to an upright position, meaning the twelve faces to the top, so after each winding cycle, both of your watches face upright.  With a four pin switch system, there are a ton of variations for turns per day, in whatever direction you choose, so this also scores big points for being suitable for just about any watch on earth.  Fit and finish certainly matches or even beats winders four or five times more expensive and it excels where it matters most, in keeping your watches steadily and quietly wound.  Such is why I really do think it's one of the best winders on the market right now, considering you can spend far less without any compromise in performance or in appearance for that matter.  I'm really impressed with this unit and will be buying a second one, once my collection expands.  Highly recommend!!!
sentence: I've had some good luck with Heiden, Belocia, even Chiyoba, and of course I love my Wolf Winder, but to date this really about the best winder I've purchased, and the price is really stunning for what you get.
title: Boxy Castle Series Double Watch Winder with LED Light - Black
target: PURCHASE(e, AGENT=I, THEME= Boxy Castle Series Double Watch Winder with LED Light - Black)
CS: PURCHASE(e, AGENT=I, THEME= watch winder, TIME= to date)

context: After moving back to the Northwest from the Southwest I was decidedly short on winter gear. When I was offered the opportunity to review this cute looking wool blend hat for a discount I was very excited. The hat arrived quickly and well packaged. As soon as I pulled it out of the package, my hopes fell. This hat feels cheap. The yarn is not soft but not heavy either. The fleece on the inside is decent but pretty thin and it only covers about 3 inches of the bottom of the hat. For another .04$ or so they could have covered the entire inside with fleece and had a fairly warm hat but the stitch on top is loose enough that it doesn't stop the wind so the top of your head is cold while your ears are warmish. The hat is also really long so you either pull it all the way down practically covering your eyes or you wear it up and have unflattering cone head. It's definitely not the worst hat I have ever seen but for 25$ this thing should be amazing quality and it just isn't. I hate leaving bad reviews, in fact, I have done hundreds of reviews and there are only a handful of 3 stars but I couldn't in good conscience tell people that this hat is worth the money when it isn't. If I had paid full price I would be mad and the hat would be going back.
sentence: It's definitely not the worst hat I have ever seen but for 25$ this thing should be amazing quality and it just isn't.

context: Let's be honest, Your looking to buy this product to do one of the following: give your body a nice shape, try to flatten your tummy, shed a few inches off your waist, or even posture. Hell, Maybe even all of them . I'm here to honestly tell you how your experience will be with this cincher.  **Please remember cinchers are different than corsets. Corsets are made for more serious waist training.  Posture: I have been using this product for about a week and a half and with it on notice a change in my posture. Mostly because with it on it is uncomfortable to really slouch. Uncomfortable, not unbearable. You most likely sit straighter because the bones in it are plastic and you might break them doing some dramatic moves. I've noticed I walk taller and sit straighter with it on.  Sizing: Based on other reviews I'm sure you notice there is a lot of issues when it comes to choosing the correct size due to the inconsistency. I'm going to try my best to make this as simple as possible. I am a 36C/D bra size. When wearing women's T-shirts I am a Medium (Men's Small) and in dresses I am most comfortable in an 8. The reviews told me to order 2 sizes up so I did, buying  an extra-large (XL).  How it Fit: The first time I ever used the cincher I was able to put it on the tightest setting (second row). Ideally you want to first be able to put it on the loosest setting (1st row) then graduate to the second you know it's working and that your waist may be getting smaller. I may have been better off getting a large. I have ordered another cincher and this time a Large. As far as the initial size I bought (XL) it's not too tight even on the second setting . When I say not too tight, I mean that I can breathe in it . I do feel compression and it does flatten me out but I'd rather have a large just for my preference so keep that in mind. I will say that the XL for me starting off on the second setting was probably a good starting point seeing as though I never typically wear cinchers or corsets.  Gym Use: So far I have used this cincher in the gym. It was not uncomfortable even when sitting down and doing floor exercises. It does give compression allowing for proper use and that little extra something to work your abs . In comparison to a typical exercise bandits does not collect a lot of sweat so it's not extra gross when taking it off after a workout.  Body Shaping: Okay, I'm sure this is where many of you jumped down to. Trust me, this was all I was searching for in reviews. So this cincher actually does give the appearance of a flatter tummy and smaller waist under my clothes, but it is NOT a dramatic difference. I bought this to introduce my tummy and waist to the idea of waist training ( if these are your intentions, this product is a good place to start) HOWEVER, if you are seeking a product to begin serious waist training, it is best to begin with a steel boned corset. This cincher easily takes away 1-2 inches of your waist. May be another inch or two more but I would need a smaller size to be sure. Does give a more flattering appearance under your clothes and active wear at the gym ,  Body Results: Like I have stated previously, I have only had the product after a week in a half. So far, I have seen a slight difference. I'm not sure if it's just when I take it off because everything still seems to be sitting in the right place. But I do feel like I'm pinching less when touching poking and my sides. The current results make me optimistic about future results so I will keep using  Flaws: I can see the cincher hooks through my clothes. I would not recommend wearing with skin tight apparel. If you bend the bones they will snap. Since I have a relatively short torso this cincher meets my bra sometimes pushing in my underwire which is sometimes uncomfortable.  Welp, that's pretty much all I have. If you have any additional comments or questions feel free to contact me at genee143@comcast.net .  I am not paid or anything I just know how hard it is to find honest thorough reviews. I am not sure if amazon has a messaging center but if they do you can message me there as well. Happy Cinching!
sentence: How it Fit: The first time I ever used the cincher I was able to put it on the tightest setting (second row).
title: Ann Michell Classic Waist Cincher (40, Beige)

context: I disagree with it saying that it's "plus sized" when they only offer the largest as an 8/10 and actual "plus size" begins at 16 typically.  I am a size 12, but I thought I would give this suit a try because I have been in need of a one piece suit for swimming.  Bikinis just aren't made for active swimming! I struggle with finding a decent fitting one piece suit because I'm tall - and it's nearly impossible to find something at a low price that isn't giving me an epic weggie or cameltoe because it's made for shorter people, so that is super frustrating. It's not something you find on the rack for 20-30 bucks at your big box stores and I'm not looking to drop over 100 bucks on a suit I just want for functionality. This suit works for what I am looking for, although I would prefer the shoulder straps would cross over in the back so that I could be sure they wouldn't slide off my shoulders while I'm swimming, although that hasn't happened yet so it could be OK, just something that concerns me a little. So - while it is not technically a plus size, it's got enough give in the 8/10 size to fit me as a 12.  The bust is a great fit (I'm a 36DD), and the best part of this suit for me is that it is for a Long Torso (I'm 5'10"). I picked out the dark blue and black suit and it is the same color as pictured on the site.  It's not a "slimming" suit, so if you have a tummy pouch, you're probably still going to see it a little because it doesn't hold it in for you, but because of the style it is more flattering than other one piece suits. The material is similar to other swimsuits, not too thin that it seems flimsy or cheaply made. The top does have some padding to maintain your modestly. The bottom cut is very modest as well, full coverage of the cheeks and not high-cut in the hips either. Modesty isn't my main purpose of buying this suit, but for those who are looking for something modest it would be a good choice. I only rated it a 4-star because it is not technically a Plus Size suit, but everything else is pretty spot on. I received this product at a discounted price or for free in exchange for an honest review.
sentence: I disagree with it saying that it's "plus sized" when they only offer the largest as an 8/10 and actual "plus size" begins at 16 typically.

context: This dress is so gorgeous! I was honestly expecting something of less quality because of the price, the location it was shipping from and the material. But, I am so surprised to have a unique and fun dress to wear to an upcoming Dr. Seuss themed event. I ordered style A001, with the paint splashes on the front and back. The white material is so gorgeous. It has an embossed look and is basically off-white on white paisley pattern. My Honey says the white reminds him of upholstery but I love it because it reminds me of old Gunny Sack dresses. The colors are more varied and much more vibrant than the photo does it justice. The splash of color on the front goes above and below the waist seam. There is a splash of color on the back but it is smaller and only from the waist seam down. It is lovely. The material is really soft, but it is very firm and has no stretch. I went by the measurements listed in the product photos and that made me the largest size available, a size 8. (I laid down one of my favorite dresses that is similar and measured the dress like the product description instructed.) I am usually a 4-6 in dresses so this was surprising. Now, I have a history of buying Amazon clothing from China and the sizes almost always run really small compared to US sizes, so I was not alarmed at ordering an 8. It took a really long time to get here, but I ordered many months in advance of the event. I think it took about a month. I arrived folded up but still neat considering how far it traveled. The fit is absolutely perfect on me and fits to my measurements!! I am so happy that this is a successful purchase because this dress is the absolute perfect dress for my event. I am a colorful person and this is going to really highlight that part of me and make me feel like a trendsetter with it's uniqueness. context: CHAPTER ONE The Boy Who Lived Harry Potter and the Sorcerer ’s Stone By J.K. Rowling Mr. and Mrs. Dursley , of number four , Privet Drive , were proud to say that they were perfectly normal , thank you very much . They were the last people you ’d expect to be involved in anything strange or mysterious , because they just did n’t hold with such nonsense . Mr. Dursley was the director of a firm called Grunnings , which made drills . He was a big , beefy man with hardly any neck , although he did have a very large mustache . Mrs. Dursley was thin and blonde and had nearly twice the usual amount of neck , which came in very useful as she spent so much of her time craning over garden fences , spying on the neighbors . The Dursleys had a small son called Dudley and in their opinion there was no finer boy anywhere . The Dursleys had everything they wanted , but they also had a secret , and their greatest fear was that somebody would discover it . They did n’t think they could bear it if anyone found out about the Potters .

context: He was a big , beefy man with hardly any neck , although he did have a very large mustache . Mrs. Dursley was thin and blonde and had nearly twice the usual amount of neck , which came in very useful as she spent so much of her time craning over garden fences , spying on the neighbors . The Dursleys had a small son called Dudley and in their opinion there was no finer boy anywhere . The Dursleys had everything they wanted , but they also had a secret , and their greatest fear was that somebody would discover it . They did n’t think they could bear it if anyone found out about the Potters . Mrs. Potter was Mrs. Dursley ’s sister , but they had n’t met for several years ; in fact , Mrs. Dursley pretended she did n’t have a sister , because her sister and her good- for-nothing husband were as unDursleyish as it was possible to be . The Dursleys shuddered to think what the neighbors would say if the Potters arrived in the street . The Dursleys knew that the Potters had a small son , too , but they had never even seen him . This boy was another good reason for keeping the Potters away ; they did n’t want Dudley mixing with a child like that . When Mr. and Mrs. Dursley woke up on the dull , gray Tuesday our story starts , there was nothing about the cloudy sky outside to suggest that strange and mysterious things would soon be happening all over the country . Mr. Dursley hummed as he picked out his most boring tie for work , and Mrs. Dursley gossiped away happily as she wrestled a screaming Dudley into his high chair . None of them noticed a large , tawny owl flutter past the window .
sentence: Mr. Dursley hummed as he picked out his most boring tie for work , and Mrs. Dursley gossiped away happily as she wrestled a screaming Dudley into his high chair .

context: His blue eyes were light , bright , and sparkling behind half -moon spectacles and his nose was very long and crooked , as though it had been broken at least twice . This man ’s name was Albus Dumbledore . Albus Dumbledore did n’t seem to realize that he had just arrived in a street where everything from his name to his boots was unwelcome . He was busy rummaging in his cloak , looking for something . But he did seem to realize he was being watched , because he looked up suddenly at the cat , which was still staring at him from the other end of the street . For some reason , the sight of the cat seemed to amuse him . He chuckled and muttered , “ I should have known . ” He found what he was looking for in his inside pocket . It seemed to be a silver cigarette lighter . He flicked it open , held it up in the air , and clicked it . The nearest street lamp went out with a little pop . He clicked it again — the next lamp flickered into darkness .
sentence: The nearest street lamp went out with a little pop .

context: “ Yes , ” said Professor McGonagall . “ And I do n’t suppose you ’re going to tell me why you ’re here , of all places ? ” “ I ’ve come to bring Harry to his aunt and uncle . context: Harry , who could see a huge Dudley tantrum coming on , began wolfing down his bacon as fast as possible in case Dudley turned the table over . context: “ I suppose we could take him to the zoo , ” said Aunt Petunia slowly , “ ... and leave him in the car ... ” “ That car ’s new , he ’s not sitting in it alone ... ” Dudley began to cry loudly . context: Uncle Vernon nearly crashed into the car in front . If there was one thing the Dursleys hated even more than his asking questions , it was his talking about anything acting in a way it should n’t , no matter if it was in a dream or even a cartoon — they seemed to think he might get dangerous ideas . It was a very sunny Saturday and the zoo was crowded with families . The Dursleys bought Dudley and Piers large chocolate ice creams at the entrance and then , because the smiling lady in the van had asked Harry what he wanted before they could hurry him away , they bought him a cheap lemon ice pop . It was n’t bad , either , Harry thought , licking it as they watched a gorilla scratching its head who looked remarkably like Dudley , except that it was n’t blond . Harry had the best morning he ’d had in a long time . He was careful to walk a little way apart from the Dursleys so that Dudley and Piers , who were starting to get bored with the animals by lunchtime , would n’t fall back on their favorite hobby of hitting him .

context: Nick was always happy to point new Gryffindors in the right direction , but Peeves the Poltergeist was worth two locked doors and a trick staircase if you met him when you were late for class . Filch found them trying to force their way through a door that unluckily turned out to be the entrance to the out-of-bounds corridor on the third floor . He would n’t believe they were lost , was sure they were trying to break into it on purpose , and was threatening to lock them in the dungeons when they were rescued by Professor Quirrell , who was passing . Filch owned a cat called Mrs. Norris , a scrawny , dust-colored creature with bulging , lamp like eyes just like Filch ’s . She patrolled the corridors alone . Break a rule in front of her , put just one toe out of line , and she ’d whisk off for Filch , who ’d appear , wheezing , two seconds later . Filch knew the secret passageways of the school better than anyone ( except perhaps the Weasley twins ) and could pop up as suddenly as any of the ghosts . The students all hated him , and it was the dearest ambition of many to give Mrs. Norris a good kick . And then , once you had managed to find them , there were the classes themselves .
